articles.author: Dave Graham
articles.description: An upcoming Ukraine peace summit, ostensibly the most ambitious bid in years by neutral Switzerland to mediate a major conflict, is instead showing how Swiss economic and security interests increasingly align with Western Europe over Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine peace summit pushes neutral Swiss toward Western embrace

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden for the first time publicly vowed to withhold weapons from Israel if its forces make a major invasion of Rafah in southern Gaza while negotiations in Cairo on a ceasefire plan for the enclave were due to continue on Thursday.
articles.title: US warns Israel that Rafah invasion will jeopardise weapons supply as assault continues

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine national security council on Friday called for Chinese diplomats to be expelled from the country for what it called a malicious disinformation campaign that had breached local laws and diplomatic protocols.
articles.title: Philippines calls for Chinese diplomats to be expelled for disinformation

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly on Friday is set to back a Palestinian bid to become a full U.N. member by recognizing it as qualified to join and sending the application back to the U.N. Security Council to "reconsider the matter favorably."
articles.title: UN General Assembly set to back Palestinian bid for membership

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Kate Abnett
articles.description: The black-clad attackers beat up Matthias Ecke so badly as he put up posters in Dresden that he needed surgery. In Nordhorn, a man threw eggs at a lawmaker then punched him in the face. In Berlin, a pensioner hit a senator on the head with a bag.
articles.title: Why German politicians are facing growing violence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's top court gave temporary bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in a graft case on Friday, allowing him to campaign in the ongoing general elections, boosting the opposition alliance of which he is a key leader.
articles.title: India top court grants temporary bail to opposition leader Kejriwal to campaign in elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The main United Nations aid agency for Palestinians closed its headquarters in East Jerusalem after local Israeli residents set fire to areas at the edge of the sprawling compound, the agency said.
articles.title: Israeli demonstrators torch part of UN compound in Jerusalem

articles.author: Ali Kucukgocmen
articles.description: Turkey has opened the ancient Chora church, one of Istanbul's most celebrated Byzantine buildings, to Muslim worshippers after it was used as a museum for more than 70 years, making it the second such major conversion under President Tayyip Erdogan.
articles.title: Turkey reopens ancient church with prized mosaics to Muslim worship

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine destroyed all 10 drones as Russia launched an overnight attack, but two people were injured and residential buildings in the Kharkiv region were consumed by fire as a result of the attack, Ukrainian officials said on Friday.
articles.title: Two injured, houses burnt in Russia's attack on Kharkiv, Ukraine says

articles.author: Emma Pinedo
articles.description: Members of three South American indigenous communities have asked Spain and UNESCO to declare a Spanish galleon that sank 300 years ago with a bountiful cargo as "common and shared heritage" from which they too should benefit.
articles.title: Indigenous groups claim stake in sunken Spanish ship, cargo off Colombia
